Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Frank R
Reviews.Content: If you're staying downtown, the Fremont is a great place to stay. It's in the middle of the Freemont Experience. The rooms are in great shape, the staff friendly, and the buffet is one of the best downtown. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Old las vegas old funky room”
Reviews.Author: kimdowns
Reviews.Content: The location was fun being on the site of the Fremont experience! But the casino was so smokey i couldn't breathe. Our room was very small but wonderfully appointed. Very comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Janece M
Reviews.Content: When checking in the desk staff were slow and indifferent. The cleaning staff on the other hand were just great and helpful. The room was smaller than expected but since we only spent sleeping hours there it was okay. The bed was very comfortable. We had a smoking room with king sized bed. Was a little noisy but tolerable. The view was great. We could look out our window and watch the shows.

Reviews.Title: “The Downtown Experience”
Reviews.Author: LeprechaunBoise
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the old Las Vegas, with all of the noisy exuberance and pizazz this is the place to go. Nothing at all like the strip there is very little pretense here. Street performers, outdoor bands at night, a zip line down the middle of Fremont Ave, and vendors or every variety. Casino's are lively but definitely not sedate or over the top. Food is inexpensive and passable, rooms are dingy but clean and incredibly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Manos37
Reviews.Content: Only complaint was the t.v. Size and channel selection. Rooms were clean and the layout was excellent. Everything from Fremont Street to the valet (no self park) to Dunkin Donuts for ur morning coffee was just a few feet from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: Mychelle71
Reviews.Content: The Fremont Hotel and Casino is what it is. An inexpensive stay in downtown Las Vegas. You definitely get what you pay for. We kind of got "stuck" here because we were attending a conference downtown at The Golden Nugget. Unfortunately our boss waited until the last minute to tell us we were going and the Nugget was full. Transportation back and forth from the strip was too expensive. We were told that the Fremont Hotel was our best option so we took it. First of all, don't let the name fool you. This is not a "hotel." This is a "motel." We stayed our first nights (pre-business) at The Pallazzo on the strip and this was good and bad. Good because it was a FABULOUS experience and kind of cushioned us for our fall when we arrived at the Fremont. Bad because it spoiled us and made the Fremont and even bigger let down. If you want luxury in any form, the Fremont is not what you want. It's basic and meager. The reviews we read before going said the room was clean. Ours not so much. You have to literally beg to get a blanket and when we got it, gross. It was like it was made of a form of melted plastic. The bathroom was so tiny even one person had to move carefully. The toilet was angled in the corner to make enough room to close the door. The shower was for a short person (but did have hot water, which is always a plus). The casino is a typical downtown experience. Super, duper smoky and packed all the time. There's a Dunkin Donuts which was kind of convenient for coffee (this was new info for me - there are not coffee pots in Vegas hotel rooms) and a morning danish, but all the food is sitting out so when you big into it (it makes me gag thinking about it) it takes like a smoked cigarette - yuck. Our room was on the Fremont Street side and until 1 a.m. or later, Fremont Street does a lights show with blaring music and fighter jet sounds. It was miserable when you had to be at 8 a.m. meetings. You can't beat the price for $50 a night - but you get what you pay for. Since we were at a conference at The Golden Nugget, we got to see some of the rooms, even in the non-remodeled Carson Tower. They were very spacious and really nice. I would never, ever stay at the Fremont again. If your'e going to Vegas on a dime, this is the place for you. But FYI, Vegas is not fun when you're going on a dime. Downtown Vegas didn't impress me at all and my experience at this motel didn't help change my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Not really my kinda place.”
Reviews.Author: 900James_M
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I was comped for my stay at Fremont and have no real complaints about the room as it was free. The decor was nice and modern and the room was clean. My big complaint is about the service. It is like they took everyone who had been fired for being rude at all of the other casinos and hired them on at the Fremont. My first run in was at the Players card booth. The lady working behind the counter acted as though she was upset that I asked a question and interrupted her conversation with another employee. Check in was not as pleasant as it could be, it was more like checking in at a public health clinic. Housekeeping was great, although I tend to tip them well. One bartender acted like it was an imposition when we asked about drink specials, but another bartender made up for that later. I knew what it was before I went. We chose to stay downtown because during our last trip we had found the big resort casino we stayed at to be a bit more flashy and showy for our tastes. We were hoping for something a little more middle of the road with the Fremont. I know that downtown is more for an older crowd, but it seemed like unless you were over 60 years of age or a bit on the trashy side, you did not get good customer service. So we spent our money in casinos elsewhere. We spent the last half of our trip on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on what you want.”
Reviews.Author: Roadman2929
Reviews.Content: When choosing a hotel you have to ask yourself what is it I am looking for. Vegas especially offers a very wide array of choices, so you really need to ask that all important question. Do you want glitz and glamor, pretty people and high end entertainment, spas and shopping? If so then the strip is the place to be. If I were treating myself and my wife to a fun vacation trip probably that's where we would head. Or if we were looking for just a basic, more budget minded, gamble a little play a little trip, then downtown might be our choice. This trip was a business trip, and downtown was simply more convenient, to say nothing of less costly. This was my first stay at the Fremont and it fit the bill very nicely, thank you. The room while not large was more than adequate. It was clean, as has been mentioned in some other reviews, tastefully redecorated recently. It was a nonsmoking room/floor and I didn't detect any smoke odor in the room although a little from the main floor does make it's way into the hall around the elevator. The bed, pillows and bedding were comfortable. The bath room was small, while I had no problems, it is a one person at a time proposition. Loved the water pressure, huge plus for me. Restauranting downtown offers a pretty wide choice, I opt mostly for sandwiches etc when not entertaining. People-watching under the canopy of the Fremont Experience is almost as good as any number of the shows one can see on the strip. But as I have said this was first and foremost a business trip. The staff was extremely friendly did their job well. Housekeeping missed servicing my in-room coffee, front desk handled it in a timely fashion. Check out was a little slow with only one person on station. Al in all have to give it a thumbs up. Not fancy, but the equal of any mid-range Motel chain. I booked as a Flight/Hotel package and was very pleased with the great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Dealer, grouchy Pit boss”
Reviews.Author: mllsssa
Reviews.Content: We stopped by here on our last day of gambling to experience Fremont street... I said and played roulette for a few hours and had a pretty good time... The downer for me was the Angry looking little men ( the Pit Bosses) that kept yelling at people and complaining about their jobs to each other... It ruins the fun if you keep getting distracted by grumps.. I would've stayed and played a lot longer if the mood had been more fun..

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: williequin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fremont Hotel in downtown Las Vegas. Although the property is old since it goes back to Vega's origins, it's still a nice play to stay. If you are looking for luxury then look someplace else. If you are looking for an inexpensive fun place then this is the place for you. The rooms are cozy and clean. The TV is old but we only watched the news while we got ready to go gamble, eat or cruise around downtown. Downtown is great and a lot different than the glizy strip but it's still a lot of fun and the casinos are close to each other. The casino is small but the dealers are fun and friendly. We even played $3 craps and blackjack.

Reviews.Title: “great Fremont location, not glitzy”
Reviews.Author: idohair4u
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2012, room was clean rooms easy to get to from the FSE , lots of dining choices, but not as glitzy as strip properties, rooms were small, but clean, could hear the noise from FSE but that did not bother us as we expected that. staff was very friendly everywhere we went. loved that it was easy to run back to your room for a minute and you truly would be gone a few minutes unlike some strip hotels where it could be 15 minutes to get back to your room. Not sure if I would stay here again, but i would give it concideration if i wanted to stay downtown

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TravlnT
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the first time after frequenting the casino many times. My stay was nothing short of perfect. Friendly and helpful staff at the check-in desk, awesome bartenders and servers, fun dealers and great housekeeping. Besides being right in the middle of Fremont St. the bus stop to go to the strip is right out the side door($7 for 24hrs vs $30 each way in a cab). The buffet is very reasonable with a wide variety and the cafe is great for some late night grub to take back to your room. The rooms are new and clean. No for the only con(s). The rooms and bathrooms are small, but fine for 1-2 people, definitely wouldn't bring the family. You can hear people in the hallways but not really from room to room. Finally the TV is old with only about 10 channels but suffices if you need a break. As long as you aren't expecting Caesars you'll do just fine here.

Reviews.Title: “down hill, every room has ac noise”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: we (ie my wife and I) changed rooms 3 times because of noise issues and then checked out at 9am the next day and moved accross the street to the nugget and payed $50 more a nite ., but it was worth it

Reviews.Title: “Went and stayed there again”
Reviews.Author: Ohlers
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel (of course because we had free rooms, so if you go make sure you get a players card and use it). The rooms are okay. It was clean. The only issue is the air conditoner/heater was really loud in our room. Gambling was horrible (but it was last time). Overall, we enjoy staying downtown. Its not as crowded as the new strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mack184
Reviews.Content: The rooms are are small, but very clean, a very good value. The downtown town experience is an experience you have to experience at least once during your stay in Las Vegas. The only down side is there is only valet parking and a little hard to find. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back”
Reviews.Author: marie n
Reviews.Content: Just loved downtown Las Vegas and our stay December 2011 for Cowboy Christmas at the Fremont Hotel/Casino. The rooms have been remodeled and nicely appointed. Bathroom is a bit short on counter space but adequate. Room was very clean and housekeeping was so helpful. Actually staff throughout the hotel/casino were very friendly. This casino is a friendly place. Valet parking was efficient and very welcome as we were able to leave some things in the car as there is no "self parking" which makes it fairly secure. There is a wonderful restaurant/buffet in the hotel as well as Dunking Donuts with the most wonderful coffee. We have stayed on the Strip before but found downtown more to our liking with so many places within easy walking distance and the pedestrians only street was fun and convenient. The lights, music and the hourly Fremont Experience is gives it a party atmosphere. There is a tickets 4 Less right across from the Fremont for easy access to show tickets throughout Las Vegas. With the pedestrians only street it's an easy walk there from the Fremont Hotel which we did every morning to check availability for shows. My daughter and I know where we will stay on our next trip to Las Vegas as we will be going back to the Fremont..

Reviews.Title: “nice new room!”
Reviews.Author: utt959
Reviews.Content: I've been going to vegas for a long time and my experience staying downtown is that it's cheap and old. I was comped a room at the Fremont and I was expecting to get what I paid for but the room was very clean. Newly painted, carpeted and well done. WOW! The Fremont is a good option if this is the level all the rooms are at. It's not five star. It's small and the bed is standard but really come on. You could do a lot worse, and I have. This is much closer to the top than the bottom in vegas. No stationary.

Reviews.Title: “fun place!”
Reviews.Author: al-diana
Reviews.Content: had another lovely stay here-great location-friendly staff-good buffet-they have small but very clean rooms with no internet access at all-you have to take your laptop to their sister property 'main street station' or over to 'krispy creme' at the 'fitz'-you can get a free picture with a million dollars at 'binions'-you can get a hot dog with a beer for $2 at 'the las vegas club' across from the 'plaza'-$3 2 egg, potato & toast breakfast at the 'fitz'-I always recommend having a rental car, but if you don't have one you can get a free shuttle from the 'fremont' to 'sam's town' & on to 'harrah's' on the strip-it's a brisk 20 minute walk to the 'premium outlet' that has 150 stores-you walk south down main & make a right at the 1st major street past the 'plaza'-you can get a bunch of very good coupons if you go to the 'fremont experience executive offices' next to walgreens across from the 'heart attack cafe'-at night it is a blast to see all of the 'photo op' people-they are looking for tips-as always, had an exciting time-lots of santa's appeared one night-heard 8000 showed up in town for a charity event......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but old rooms”
Reviews.Author: hawaii5bro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 11-11-11 weekend. The location is great if you're looking for a downtown location. All other casinos are easily in walking distance. Live bands outside and the freemont st. Experience. Lots of gaming available here. The room was ok. It still had an old CRT TV set. Other hotels in the area all have the flat screens. Rooms havent been remodelled in what seems like the 80's. But it had a bed and bathroom and thats all we really needed. Keep in mind that if your room faces freemont street it will be load until the bands stop playing.

Reviews.Title: “For Some Fun Times and Very Good Gambling”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2u
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the title, I rated this hotel a "4" for gambling and not necessarily for the rooms, although the rooms are bit smaller than what you'd get up on the strip, the excellent gambling makes up for it all. We just recently got back from an 11/11/11 trip and definitely enjoyed bringing back home all the money we went up with, plus more. We enjoyed playing every single day (6 days of fun) around the clock at the Fremont and other downtown vicinity hotels. Rooms have been updated as far as the decor goes, can't change the size of the room, but it's still kept clean, no flat screen tv, but that's ok, we're not here to stare at walls 24/7 or the TV...but strictly to play, enjoy and have a lot of fun, which we always get when staying at the Fremont. Table games, slot machines, poker machines, you name it, they got it and a lot of guests to boot, which makes this one of the best old times downtown "happening" hotels on the Fremont street experience. Now, don't go there expecting a 4 or 5 diamond rated room, because like I mentioned earlier, its "old time" Vegas, and not your spa & resort style uptown atmosphere, but the years of "old gone by," where the real gamblers of past preferred staying and still do. As far as food goes, we skipped the buffet this time because most of our family vacationing there were staying at either the Main Street Station or the California (all Boyd hotels), so most meals were usually at the Main Street station hotel & casino. We did pick up some last minute in-between and after gambling eats at the open cafe where you can find a variety of fast food such as chinese, American, etc. and I can't forget to mention that huge bowl of delicious oxtail soup (with rice), you'll just have to try this one out. Also, be sure to try Tony Roma's restaurant, known to make some excellent ribs and other goodies, but, be sure to make reservations in advance. The overall happy atmosphere at this hotel is due not only to the type of guests that patronize this place, but also due to a lot of friendly, courteous and professional employees who'll help to make your stay comfortable, enjoyable and memorable. As far as parking goes, I normally only do valet in Vegas, hey, just let them park your car (it's much safer), and what's a two or three dollar tip when you'll be dropping even more into that slot machine or on that favorite table game of yours, for me, I call it convenience by getting right off at the the front door. Fremont is one of the best located downtown hotels there is with a 1 minute walk (I'm not kidding either) to Binions, Golden Nugget and the Four Queens casino & hotel. Fremont is a "Boyds" casino, & one can venture to it's sister properties, the Main Street Station or the California hotel & casino via a 4 - 5 min. walk down the street. Don't forget to sign up for your Bconnected players card which can also be used at all "Boyds" and "Coast" properties, and used to get "comp" rooms, discounts off buffets when you show your card, and at some of the sun dry shops too. Fremont is a good value for your money (it's not the Venetian) but you'll have loads of fun staying at this iconic oldie of an oldie hotel. Enjoy and happy gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Frenont Hotel Seafood Buffett”
Reviews.Author: GBrooks800
Reviews.Content: Tuesday, November, 15, 2011, was the worst meal that I have experienced in 30 years. If the meal had not been free, as we had two free buffett' s presented to us that evening by Ms Terri Lorenzen, casino host, it could only have been worse if we would have had to pay for the mess. This is the fourth trip to the Fremont area in the last two years, and have eaten the f Fremont Seafood buffett, on two previous trips, and found the dinner good, something has happened about the quality which is terrible, the best thing about the meal was the ice cream, do not try this, and I will not eat anything from the Fremont until this has been corrected, even saw a floor manager, correct a waiter in front of four hundred people, I felt sorry for the waiter, however this shows me, not only is the food horrible, the staff as well is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: onespiceylady
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. This was our 2nd stay at the Fremont and once again we enjoyed it there. They have a wonderful group of housekeeping ladies there, they are always friendly and helpful. My mom did not like the location of our room the 1st night, but we were given another room promptly the following morning. We only ate at the Buffet and Lanai restaurant which were both okay. I did not win any money there on the slots the entire time of my visit, but someone won 8 million there Nov. 7th our first night there. I spent one day walking the strip and it is just too tiring. Pretty much everything Downtown is close walking distance whick works for me. Enough entertainment to keep you happy. Looking forward to my next visit there. Yes, the rooms are small but they were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Keep An Open Mind”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: The basic premise for happiness at the Fremont Hotel, or any of the other Fremont Street/Downtown Las Vegas hotels, is to accept that there are two separate, distinct parts to Las Vegas. One part is The Strip, with upper end properties like the Bellagio, Caesars, Treasure Island, Venetian and Wynn; the other is Fremont Street/Downtown, with properties like the Four Queens, Golden Nugget, El Cortez, Plaza and Fremont. If you are after glitz, glamour and beautiful people, try the Strip. If your taste is more pedestrian, you very well might enjoy the Fremont. At the price I paid, $40 per night for a king bed room, it was perfect. Yes, the room TV’s are not flat screens, nor are there many channels, and if you need Internet, keep looking. But if you want a basic comfortable room, you could do a whole lot worse. Kudos to the sixth floor housekeeping staff, who could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. I checked in on October 24, several hours before the stated 3PM check in. Elevators were quick and the lobby had plenty of seating. My room, 631, was quiet, clean and well lit. The bed was plenty firm and while the air conditioner/heating unit under the window was older it was efficient. There was an upholstered easy chair and all of the standard bathroom toiletries. The four window shades were slat-styled and one window opened about six inches. The Fremont is in a quadrant that includes Binions, the Golden Nugget and the Four Queens. All have excellent, economical food choices, as does the Golden Gate a block away in one direction and the Fitz, a block away in the other direction. Meal comps/discounts are far easier to come by Downtown than at the Strip, and table minimums are as low as $2. I know that I am going to lose money gambling in Vegas, and the lower minimums make losing far more fun. The Fremont Hotel is a safe, reliable and economical hotel with amble dining options, under the Fremont Street Experience canopy, but if you demand The Strip type treatment you probably should book elsewhere. For travelers who want to save cab fare to and from the airport, which can be $40 or more each way, consider the new, public Westcliff Airport Express (WAX Bus) operated by the Regional Transportation Commission of Southern Nevada. It runs every hour; the trip is $2 (paid as you board) and takes 30 minutes. At the airport, follow the signs in baggage claim to Ground Zero, walk across the access road and all the way to the right. The Fremont Hotel stop is at 4th and Carson, and the drivers are helpful. It’s a two block walk to the Fremont and on the way back to the airport, the bus stop is literally across the street from the Fremont. (http://www.rtcsouthernnevada.com/transit/route/westcliff/westcliff(09-18-11).pdf). The Fremont’s staff will get you to the right place to get back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: shellyncharlotte
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old, has been remodeled but has that cigarette smoke mixed with mold smell. There's nowhere to get cooled off; the casino floor is open air, so if it's hot outside, it's even hotter inside. The a/c has been running full blast for days now in our room and we can't get it lower than 72. The bathrooms are small, but functional and has pretty decent water pressure in the shower. I'd say that my biggest disappointment is with the in house dining options, all of which have been a HUGE letdown. We tried the Paradise Buffet, the Lanai Express and Tony Romas. Its clear that each restaurant has cut so many corners to save money that what they're offering at this point is barely edible. We actually had Pizza Hut delivered on our 4th night and we were thrilled to have something resembling real food!! I've never been so happy with greasy pizza. I think that's a shame when we're on vacation in Las Vegas. Also- I lost a couple hundred dollars in the casino- never even won a dollar back, so coming here in hopes of loose slots is a thing of the past.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique downtown”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: Renovated rooms and part of the Boyd Group which assures a certain level of quality. I enjoyed it and would return for a deal. When I stayed, had newer furnishings and only lacked flatscreen TV for the complete upgrade. I liked the window shutters and view over Binions. Shuttle to Sam's Town available. The styling of rooms gave it somewhat of a boutique feel, pretty decent. The Main Street and California casinos are sister properties--Cali has the only pool. The casino packs in the tables, so it seems a bit crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: ickle25uk
Reviews.Content: For the price you cannot get better. We booked or the Friday but got in a day early and when no one else was helpful they squeezes us in and let us have the same room for the fri save us moving.... Staff are friendly and the tables are cheaper than the bigger casinos so you get more play and the people are great defo stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and located Downtown Vegas. Rooms are clean and staff is super friendly. No long walks to get to your room. Dunkin Donuts on property as well as Tony Roma's--both were excellent. Fremont has old time cash quarter slots--quite the experience to see your quarters pour out or not.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sandy2708
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Fremont Hotel and Casino and we had the best time. The check in staff was very friendly. We ate several times at the buffet and Lanai Express. There is nothing better than a cheese burger at midnight. The casino staff was very helpful and lively. Their positive and fun attitudes added to our experience. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Down home especially for the Island crowd”
Reviews.Author: lanit50
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Fremont for years. Much prefer downtown to the glitz of the strip. Folks who frequent the casinos downtown are just downhome folks looking for a good time at a reasonable cost. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean though small and there is no internet access unless you hook into the Vegas net for a cost. The food at the Lanai is excellent and cheap. . .enough to feed a small country! The buffet is good and reasonable. Easy access is the Fremont Experience and other nearby casinos. . .not the Ritz but lots of fun at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “You can't get over the size of the room.”
Reviews.Author: ABronxTale
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Golden Nugget when I stay at Downtown Las Vegas. The service there has gone so far down( see my review Aug 2010) I decided to go some where else this trip. I chose the Freemont because the rooms were renovated, it is on Fremont Street and the price was decent. The staff was excellent. This is one area where the Fremont does well. When I checked in I had a room which faced the Fremont Experience. The room was noisy. I went back to the front desk and Melissa changed my room without a problem. The room which was a non smoking room smelled with old cigarette smoke. We travel with coffee packs and placed them on the A/C which helped somewhat. The bed felt damp which we assumed was from the sheets not being throughly dried. The room although away from the crowd of Fremont Street was still noisy. We bought ear plugs at a local Walmart. The brunch buffet was good and I have to thank Ramon for keeping the champagne flowing. Despite the great staff I will probably not be going back due to the room size and the 10 channels that are only available on the TV. How can a hotel in this day and age not have cable? I will probably stay a a sister hotel Main Street Station or the Plaza which is going through a complete renovation. Too bad the rooms can't ne as good as the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little room!”
Reviews.Author: steph124ny
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much for 51 bucks on a Saturday night in Vegas. So, I was very pleasantly surprised by my room at The Fremont. Although very small (most downtown rooms are) it was updated and spotless. It had a modern decor and the bed was very comfortable. All of the staff that we encountered were genuinely friendly and helpful. I'm a Vegas strip girl at heart, but for a night or two downtown, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Fremont. I felt it was an excellent value for what I paid. The Sunday brunch was quite tasty and my champagne glass was never less than half full. For about 12 dollars, it was also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: vegastogo
Reviews.Content: this is the place to stay in vegas they have great comps friendly service and they also have great payouts have been staying here for over 20 years and i love the people that work here must be a great place to work because we see the same faces year after year give them 6 stars if i could

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and good price. But valet parking only.”
Reviews.Author: mpmpmg
Reviews.Content: I like the color and how they decorate the room. Quiet. The room was a little small. Good location. There was only valet parking, crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and place”
Reviews.Author: dinondlbc
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and the staff and employees were very nice and friendly. The biggest knock was no internet access and the tv sets suck!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You would think they would update the tv sets to at least 2000 models, instead they had old school 24" bulky junk that had rolling picture and static sound. The Fremont experience downtown was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Fremont stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead88
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 24 hour room service, erupting volcanos or ultra lounges with bottle service then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a great location and a great value for the money in an old school type setting then this is the place for you. Left home in the early hours on a Sunday morning and arrived for checking in at 9:30 Vegas time. No problem checking in. Room was ready and we were off to room 819. Asked then about the possibility of getting a refrigerator for the room anditwas delivered before we even finished unpacking. Yes, it is true the rooms are on the small side and so is the bathroom but they are more than functional and clean. Housekeeping did a great job of resetting everything on a daily basis. Everyone throughout the property is more than friendly and happy to help you out. Enjoy a stop several times at the Dunkin Donuts and it makes a convenient late night stop on the way back to the room. Had dinner one night at Tony Roma's and it was fantastic. Will cover that in a separate section but it was very very good. So going back to the original statement if you are looking for a great no-frills Vegas place to stay, The Fremont is it. Only downside I can come up with is that there arevery few channels available on the television. But hey, it's Vegas and who needs TV anyway. Nothing on TV could be nearly as entertaining as the people out on the Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: libertybell
Reviews.Content: * Check-in is fast and courteous, bellman was fast and helpful, prices are great, maid service was fine and early * High floors are quiet and non-smoking, but ice & vending stop at the 10th floor, so you'll have to travel to lower floors for same * Lots of visible security in the casino and hotel * Location is excellent, Fremont experience right outside both main entrances. * Valet is convenient, fast and friendly * Room is small as is the bathroom, think master bedroom at most peoples mid sized homes. Functional, but cramped (especially if you get a refrigerator and/or coffee maker sent up) * A/C was fair at best and was the same on our last summer stay. They really aren't adequate to 'chill' the rooms during the day in the summer heat. They're fine for sleeping at night, but you won't want to hang out in the room during the day * TV is an old small tube type and the channels are very very limited (14 channels...approx. 4 hotel, 6 news, 3 local and a Turner channel (TBS or TNT, can't remember which) * Restaurants and selection are quite good *Tony Romas, excellent food, value and service * Buffet, excellent ambiance, service, price and food for the breakfast & brunch. Wasn't too impressed with the dinner the one night we went, *Lanai Express, good value, good taste, open all night but closes from 7am to 11am, so go to Duncan Donuts for your coffee * Gaming, everything from A to Z (tables, slots, keno, sports, etc)......and we won a lot on our last 3 trips Would recommend it (as I've been 3X already myself). Only real down sides were dated & limited TV and below average a/c for us.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: NSummer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fremont because I got into town very late and didn't want to spend a ton on a room I would only be in for a few hours. The experience was mixed at best. The staff was pleasant and check in was easy. Unfortunately, I was given a smoking room and I don't smoke. The room smelled horrible. The room was small with a tiny bathroom but this didn't bother me. Additionally, you get a lot of noise from the street below so if you are a light sleeper beware. Overall, I probably would not go back, room cleanliness or the lack there of is a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not glitzy, but a good time”
Reviews.Author: wildcat2003
Reviews.Content: After getting frustrated with tight slots on the strip, we checked out old Vegas for cheap eats and gaming. Enjoyed the 99 cent margaritas and the looser slots. Not glitzy, but a good time.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shame about the city!”
Reviews.Author: mhcd_2000
Reviews.Content: Very nice, friendly hotel, situated about 20mins walk from the Stratosphere tower where the strip begins. Not too central for the strip though, we walked into town and took the bus back and it was the most expenisve and slowest bus in the world. took about one hour to get home at 11pm from the southern end of the strip. Hotel is clean and tidy and located directly in the Fremont district. If you love to party then this is a good place to be, for us it was too much. Loud, shouting and drunk people. Inside the hotel however there was none of this and a good nights sleep was had. The only thing I did not like about the hotel was that it said parking was included in the price and when we arrived it was Valet parking only, no self parking, therefore being forced again to tip for something which we could have quite easily done by ourselves. This is a good hotel overall for Vegas, but with Vegas itself you either love it or hate it, and we hated it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown property”
Reviews.Author: reviews1phxaz
Reviews.Content: We checked in late Friday night. From parking to checking in and getting to the room, it took about 5 minutes. The room was nicely decorated, It was small but not too small. I never felt cramped. Most downtown hotel rooms are small anyways. I would say this one may be a bit larger than others on Fremont. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only thing I think that would make these rooms better is if they update the electronics in this room. Maybe a flat screen or an ipod docking station. Besides that I would say the rooms are nice. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller is Better!”
Reviews.Author: luckharm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fremont Hotel and Casino in downtown Las Vegas and we loved it. This was the first time we did not stay at a strip Hotel/casino and now we never will again. The Fremont was cozy and welcoming. The room was small but recently renovated and it had a comfortable bed and pillows, two of our biggest requirements. Also the Fremont experience with all of the other casinos and shops were just outside our doors. I recommend the Fremont for your next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Fremont and will come back again”
Reviews.Author: marn77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great trip to downtown Las Vegas. This time, we tried the Fremont, as we have found that we gamble and eat at the Fremont more than any other hotel on Fremont Street, regardless of which hotel we have stayed at previously. We were pleasantly surprised. We started off in a room with two beds, but they were only doubles and we really did not care for that, especially if you are used to queen size beds. We asked to be moved the next day to a room with a king size bed and found that it was much better for us. Both rooms were clean, bathrooms on the small side, but certainly suitable. We love eating at Tony Roma's and highly recommend them, especially for ribs (that's all we've ever tried there). We have enjoyed the buffet for breakfast and dinner in the past, but this time, felt that the quality was not as good as previous visits. Another reason that we chose the Fremont this time was because of it's central location. You are literally across the street from other casinos and easy to walk to the others, especially with people who may have trouble walking long distances. We stayed on the west side of the 14th floor and had a nice view. We were advised that higher rooms could be warm in the summer. I imagine lower rooms could hear music from Fremont Street. We will most likely stay at the Fremont on our next trip in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: rosey89
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very friendly staff and good casino vibe . The rooms are very small and air-conditioning very noisy. The tv is out of date but clean and comfy for 1 person. It would have been nice to have comforters or blankets. We happen to be there when it was cold. The lanai is great for breakfast, lunch or a quick snack. The buffet was just ok and would not have paid full price. But loved the miso soup at the breakfast buffet. Rocky Mountain chocolates is yummy! The best thing is the others hotels are so close, if you are not having luck at one go to the others, Would not hesitate to go back. Would be even better if they would update. Rosey

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable downtown hotel, yes there is wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the previous 5 reviews, it's worth the $35 a nite but not much more with the Golden Nugget accross the street. At check in the clerk told me there was no in room internet - and I believed her until on day 2 I searched for available wireless internet connections and there is one called citywide wireless, they seem to cover the entire city but don't pay a cut to the hotels - excellent signal strength and connection - $9.99 a day

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: me787
Reviews.Content: Talk about no care attitude from front desk staff. Rude and inconsiderate without even trying to listen to you. Did not leave a good impression with this attitude.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: al-diana
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean & friendly-rooms are very small-the rooms with 2 beds are larger, I noticed-the only bad feature of this hotel was there was no internet at all-you had to take your laptop to main street station or to the krispy kreme at the fitz-there is a free shuttle to sam's town-I walked to the premium outlets & it was only 20 minutes away-great mall- buses in vegas now charge $5 for a 2 hour trip or $7 to ride all day-downtown is lots of fun, especially if you can't do too much walking-prices are good-magnolia's at the 4 queens offers a $7.99 prime rib-fitz offers a $1.99 2 egg & potato breakfast & a $9.99 full slab of ribs which includes a soup & salad bar-california hotel has their $8.99 prime rib dinner which includes a salad bar & cherries jubilee-lots of photo opportunities in the evening with people dressed up as celebrities (looking for tips)-they have 3 stages at the fremont street experience & usually someone at each stage-lots of sexy dancing girls all around-we had a fun time staying at the fremont hotel-a great value for your money-

Reviews.Title: “WHAT HAPPENED”
Reviews.Author: pal76
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Fremont most often,have for many years,and I love location,rooms, housekeeping,,I could never say any thing bad about how they clean the room. But what happened to the food?? We went to the Seafood Buffet,horrible,no clams,fish was over cooked,sushi looked like it was made the day before,that was bad enough. We did have breakfast at the buffet and it was average. We had breakfast in the cafe,burnt hash browns,cold in the middle. Needless to say we started eating at the Cal and Main Street.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Shakersalt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at MGM Grande for our first 2 nights this trip and then 4 more at Freemont. Although the room was smaller and a little outdated at the Freemont it was clean and comfortable. An absolute steal when comparing nightly rates at Freemont and MGM. It tends to be a little noisy at night with the Freemont experience but shame on us for being in bed before midnight. The Freemont has given us more complimentary offers over the past 2 years than any other hotel and I am not dissapointed we took a chance and stayed. Based on the recent comps I can say I will return. The Silverton Hotel although 10 minutes off the strip is also a wonderful budget minded hotel. If you are looking for upscale modern perks I would highly suggest the Signature at MGM Grande. We stayed there our last visit and it was amazing! Last I checked though they have not offered 5 complimentary days as other smaller casinos have. If you love the main strip and are not into downtown but want to stay at Freemont rent a car. Dealing with the Deuce can be somewhat of a hassle. All in all I would reccomend the Freemont Hotel as a very good option for the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont is a Great Hotel/Casino Downtown”
Reviews.Author: VegasTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here over the weekend. I was a little nervous driving in because of some bad reviews. As soon as we checked in I knew there was nothing to nervous about. Valet (the only parking option) is located with a minute from the front desk. In about 5 minutes we were in our room. The rooms are on the small side but clean and nicely decorated. I would say they are nicer than some of the standard rooms on the strip (Harrahs, Flamingo, Ballys, Monte Carlo, New New York, Hooters). Though they are small you don't feel cramped. My husband and I stayed in here just fine. We even had a couple friends in the room drinking with us for a while, and we had more than enough space. The bathroom is super tiny but its set up just right. You don't feel claustrophobic at all. We were on the 4th floor facing Binions and we didn't hear any of the (cab or car noise) others had complained about. The only thing that could have made our stay better was if they offered room service. Luckily there were some little places to eat right down stairs with very good prices. We brought food back to the room one night (3.99 for 2 eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, and toast).Awesome deal. Fremont is an awesome place to stay! Slots are loose too!

Reviews.Title: “A nice budget option”
Reviews.Author: Bostsean
Reviews.Content: The location on Fremont St. really can't be beat. Room was small, but looked like it had been renovated fairly recently, decore reminded me of IKEA. Room was well kept and clean, bathroom was small but everything worked and the amenities were nice. TV was a big old thing, but worked fine. Dining options were OK, but the nice thing about staying downtown is that all the resturants (and casinos) are an easy walk, you don't feel trapped like at the mega-resorts on the strip. Staff was friendly and efficient, casino is one of my favorites to play in. A good, clean (but small) room at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: NightLion
Reviews.Content: Went back to the Fremont for the first time in a while to stay on a free room offer. The offer specifically said "free meals" but in reality I was given a book of "Aloha" coupons that only gives discounts to the buffet, nothing actually free. Rooms seem to have been redecorated since last stay and are a little nicer now, though still a little small. TV only gets a few channels. Only sheets, no blanket on the bed, which made sleeping a little tough. Fremont Street Experience show outside is pretty loud at night. Buffet isn't spectacular but it's pretty good. Casino is above average but comps seem a little tight. No self-parking but free valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: SHIP5182
Reviews.Content: Very clean but small room, very small bathroom. Great location Downtown, fun Casino with low limits.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely cheap. Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: ke1con
Reviews.Content: I prefer Fremont Street over the Strip. In my opinion, it is really great and compact place, to entertain, with this feeling of the old Las Vegas. The Streep is too plastic, too huge, too alienating for me. Fremont Hotel and Casino is a very solid place. Basic, but clean and well located. I really recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BulldougTucson
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights, checking in Aug 27, 2010. I had read from a previous review that the rooms facing Binion's were loud at night with taxi cabs honking. I asked for a room in a quiet area and was graciously accomodated. The room was small, but clean. I had the room to myself, but if my wife had been travelling with me, it may have been a bit crowded. For the price of the room, I was very pleased. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and there was a nice shower. Can't beat the $2 Heinekens and Coronas served 24 hours. Helpful hint: Upon checking out Sunday morning, I had a 7 hour drive back to Tucson. Went to "The Golden Gate Hotel Casino" and got a huge roast beef sandwich for the ride back. Stopped at the nearby Golden Nugget Starbucks for a coffee and had a great ride back. Traffic at the Hoover Dam was fine both ways. When I was out there Memorial Weekend, there were delays of about one hour. By the way, Fremont Hotel only has valet parking. Also in my opinion best Bloody Mary in Las Vegas is served at "Hennesey's" which is down the street on the corner of Fremont Street and Las Vegas Blvd. Only $3 and if you put $20 in the Video Poker machine at the bar, your first drink is free. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “FREE EQUALS GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: M3Prince
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here this past weekend for 2 nights free. It was pretty much a no frills room with a small room and bathroom. The TV was pretty old and small. Overall, the room was clean. We did not hear much noise outside our rooms and there werent any skecthy characters running around the floors. Tony Romas is pretty bad although the Paradise Buffet was a pleasant experience. If you want Bellagio quality, then go to Bellagio (which we did) but if you want an inexpensive meal, its fine. Casino was a lot of fun and we did most our gambling here. My suggestion is as follows: If you get a freebie, or Golden Nugget is charging high prices during your visit, stay the freemont. Then check into the Golden Nugget for the $39 rate during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean but a bit stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Alliecat12
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and the desk clerk was lovely, we were upgraded to a suite because there was no more non smoking rooms. The room was nice and clean but I have now stayed twice at this hotel and the air conditioner is a little weak making the room stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “What ever happened to taking the initiative?”
Reviews.Author: kkndmagee
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week with my daughter, no pool, no deals for staying there for my duration and there were no types of kids specials for my 9 year old. I had a coupon for buy one meal, get the other at 50% off. I had to pay for an adult meal for my daughter, but couldn't use the coupon, because she wasn't 21 years old. Was it because there was alcohol served? No, she wasn't 21 years old, so the coupon didn't apply to her, but I still had to pay adult price for her, right, no thanks. We never at there for the whole week. Needed a refrigerator, wasn't enough plugs in the hotel room for phone charging, computer hookup, lights, tv, clock and refrigerator. We had to unplug a couple items. Last day leaving and I needed to use cart to carry luggage to my car. Went downstairs to front desk and asked may I use the cart. The Rep at the counter said that the Bellhop would be right back, they are understaffed today (even though it's 4th of July weekend?). I stated that I was in a hurry, the Rep stated that for insurance reasons that guests aren't allowed to use the carts without a Bellhop, they are paid for assist guests in that way. I completely understand, but I couldn't wait, so I just brought everything down myself. I had 2 luggages for each my daughter and I, our laptop bags (2), bag of food (1 big bag), gifts we bought, purses, we had a total of probably about 10 bags. Got downstairs, had everything in front of the elevator. Bellhop and Rep behind the counter watched me bring everything out of the elevator. I went to the front desk again in front of the Bellhop and asked could I use the cart again. Now, I would think that someone looking at a woman and a girl bring 10 bags out of the elevator would bring the cart over (mind you there were no customers at this time) and just assist them in loading the cart and taking it to my car. I assumed wrong. Once again, the Rep said that I cannot let you use the cart without the Bellhop, but the Bellhop just stood there and stared at me. I said, 'you see my things there.' He said again, we can't let you use it for insurance reasons. Then the Bellhop says, 'You can't use my cart without me." I just looked at them both and I was about to say, "Do I need to ask?", but then I stopped and just began picking my things up and taking them to me car myself. The Valet helped me place my bags in my car. I went back to speak to the Rep, but by then he had a customer. So I gave the Valet a $20 tip. For doing his job and the Bellhop's job (according to the insurance provision said the Rep behind the counter). I will never stay there again and I will recommend not staying there if you have any children, if you expect courtesy, initiative, respect, and to not have to get on your hands and knees and beg for help.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont is fun basic lodging with a great casino in the middle of downtown LV activity.”
Reviews.Author: ALANSC7
Reviews.Content: After two nights in the hustle and bustle of the strip and then another two nights in the crowded Golden Nugget, the Fremont was a welcome relief. So call me an old fuddy-duddy but I am what I am. I drove my rental car up to the valet (no self-park at the Fremont) who whisked it away promptly. I walked the 20 steps to check-in where my room was ready even though I was there early in the morning. The tower elevators are just another 20 steps from check-in and I was in my room about 10 minutes after arrival. Of course this was a Thursday morning and I'm sure that it's not quite that quick during busy weekend times. The Fremont is an older hotel and not luxurious by any standard. However the room was clean and roomy enough even though it was a tad on the worn side. Hey it was under $ 40.00 a night when I was there. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean, and the TV worked! The noise level from the street at night can be a little bothersome, but it quiets down after midnight. It's in the middle of Fremont street action so that's to be expected. Ask for a floor on the upper floors and away from the street to avoid the noise. The staff in the hotel and the casino was courteous, friendly, and helpful all around. It's a much slower pace than the strip and a much older demographic during the week. The buffet is very nice and very inexpensive. There was no “resort fee” added to the bill. The Fremont is part of the Boyd chain so your B-Connected players card works in all of their casinos. Your points build up and they are more generous than many other players clubs. I am a confirmed “Low Roller” but still was able to trade points for buffets since they discount the buffet if you pay with points! The Fremont's location on Fremont Street is convenient to all of the other downtown casinos and that's what I love about downtown. If your luck's run cold at one table or machine, another casino is but a few steps away. After the sun goes down there is the fabulous Viva Vision screen over the street which gives new meaning to "Music Video". This is music you don't just hear and see, it's music you FEEL!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: doggiedaddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for free and had four free buffet tickets so I can't complain. The rooms were small but updated. The bathroom is the smallest I've seen but clean. The front desk was efficent. The parking valets were great. But that little bitty old fashiond tv thats smaller that my pc screen is pathetic. The advertise a flat screen on their website but when you get in it back to the 90's. Stay on a higher floor and the noise isn't bad. I will be back, I've stayed here 5 times, 3 for free. The buffet is better than the last time I came too.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service in the Paradise Buffet/Cafe is severely lacking!”
Reviews.Author: hogggit
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great! Right on Fremont Street Experience. However, rooms are smaller than average and the bathrooms are ridiculous! You could sit on the toilet and shave your legs in the tub, it's that small! The towel racks are actually IN the shower. The hotel has a buffet/cafe food is decent but service sucks big time. Staff is rude and unfriendly. They make you feel like they're doing you a favor by seating you, and bringing you drinks etc. If you are only looking for a place to lay your head, then this hotel would suffice. Beds were comfortable enough but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatterdema
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in May. The hotel is perfectly clean and well maintained. The room was on the small side, reminding me of places I stayed in Europe. Housekeepers were especially nice and helpful. I had a room on the 4th floor looking out at the bus stop and Fremont St. While it is a very busy street, I was not bothered at all by any noise. If you are just looking for a nice, clean, well maintained hotel, at a reasonable rate, you really cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted for $36 per night!”
Reviews.Author: rkStinger
Reviews.Content: I got the room I requested, nonsmoking, king bed, close to the elevator, on the 10th floor, on the north side of the hotel - away from the Fremont experience. I had NO problem with noise at all! The room was small, but very clean. The bath had everything I needed. For females, putting on makeup, this might be a problem, as there is not much counter space? The TV only had like 12 channels, but who cares about that? The bed was very nice & soft, I slept very comfortable. The aspect I liked most was the hotel layout. The guest evevators are located near the valet (main entrance) right across from the check in desk. There is also another elevator just down the hall that is also convienient. There were security guards, that were present, but they were NOT guarding the elevators (ONLY) & not bothering guests, asking to see their room keys. They were doing their jobs by guarding the WHOLE casino. I had a problem with this at other LV hotels, they almost frisked my GF once, because she forgot her room key. True, you have to walk from the elevators across the casino to get to Fremont street, but the walk is only about 150 feet. You walk straight across the casino & you don't have to weave around gambling pits to get there. I only spent my time at the Fremont sleeping there, because I play poker (not offered at the Fremont) Binions & GN are a short walk, which is OK for me. This is by FAR the best hotel VALUE I have ever had in LV! Much better than the Luxor (too confusing & too crowded), Excalibur (showing it's age, falling into dis-repair & too many kids), MGM (WAY too BIG), Four Queens (BAD hotel layout, you need a guide dog to get from elevators to fremont street), Golden Nugget (nice hotel, but WAY too expensive & over rated). The Fremont was GOOD, nothing fancy, but good for a few days stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fremont Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: gerryquin
Reviews.Content: Room clean, maid service good each day, front desk personnel helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Noisy Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gambla
Reviews.Content: If you stay up all night you won't mind the ear blasting Fremont Experience. It is 11:24 pm now and I want to sleep but can't with all this racket. This place is the pits--as in race track. Be sure to bring some good sound isolation earphones if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Brett_Travis09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days in March. We were able to check in early, at 9am that was fantastic! Rooms were average size, not the biggest, but very clean and modern. The only down side was that they dont have flat screen tv's. But its Vegas who is in their rooms much!!! Another thing that was a downside was that our toliet overflowed twice during our stay. Location was perfect, right on Fremont Street which is a blast. So much to do and see and a very short walk across the street to other casinos. Next time in Vegas I will for sure stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “loud and smelled of smoke”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: I guess no one goes to Vegas to sleep, and The Fremont rooms will not help you find sleep, either. Our room was on the side facing the Fremont Street Experience - a loud light show that ran for about ten minutes at the top of the hour until midnight. Also, the doors were paper-thin so that when someone knocked on the door across the hall at 5 a.m. to wake up the occupants, it woke us up, too. Non-smoking rooms were all taken, and our room reeked of the smoke from the previous occupant. On the plus side, the bed and pillows were comfortable enough, and the hotel has a good location for the downtown casinos. The stay was very inexpensive. The breakfast buffet was pretty good but not great: cook-to-order omelettes, scrambled eggs, a few kinds of meat, fresh fruit, pastries.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHobos
Reviews.Content: The Fremont is located in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas and is an exceptional value. The price was amazingly low for a three night stay (which included the weekend) and the room, while a bit small, was very clean, modern decor. Shower worked great, beds were super comfortable. Restaurants right in the hotel and countless surrounding the property. I would totally stay here again and highly recommend it to all. Its not a high end place like Wynn or such but if staying downtown, I doubt I would stay any where else. A fun, great place!! Oh....one thing...there is no wireless internet but you can walk over to the sister property of Main Street station and use the wireless in the player's club area. I thought this would be highly inconvenient but worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You For A Pleasant Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: catcansing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed at the Fremont the first week of November. We had a very enjoyable time. The rooms are small but who goes to Vegas to stay in the room. The housekeeping staff do a fantastic job our room was cleaned and restocked everyday. Also our room was very quiet and comfortable. The casino and hotel staff were always very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again on future trips. Center of all the action at Fremont Street. The buffet was very good and had a great choice of menu items. Be sure to get your players card and take advantage of comps and discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Scam!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chopper_p
Reviews.Content: Do not use the bank machines at the Freemont Hotel. The bank machines themselves are not what you need to worry about, it is the crooked casino cashier's. Whe you use the bank machines they provide you with a voucher you need to bring to the cashier. The cashier will find some reason that they cannot give you the cash. They will claim that if they do not process the voucher the funds will be returned to your account , this is NOT true. Instead of taking their word for it I contacted my bank who informed me that the money was out of my account and the transaction was closed. I agrgued with the unsavoury staff for about 15 minutes when they threatened to call security....I welcomed this and suggested they call the police as well so I could file a complaint. Some moments later their greasy supervisor arrived and I had to argue with him for 30 minutes. When they realized I was not taking no for an answer and would not leave until I received my money, they caved and handed me my cash. This put a bad spin on an otherwise great trip.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Disgusted!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fremont a few times in the past. We were perfectly happy there until the last day of our last trip. We were in Room 602 and were getting ready for our 11:OO AM check-out when we saw a cockroach sitting on the bathroom sink. As anyone reading this knows,there is no such thing as just one cockroach! Needless to say,we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeled rooms, but with old lumpy beds”
Reviews.Author: 808travelers
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas 4 to 5 times a year. We usually stay at the Golden Nugget in downtown Vegas, but had a one night between hotels, so we tried the Fremont. Just glad it was for one night. The rooms are very small and the ceilings are low in the bathroom, which makes you feel a little claustrophobic. Although the remodel has a nice contemporary feel and look, the beds were most uncomfortable and lumpy. Sorry, if there is a remodeled room why not do the mattresses too?! We'll stick to the GN as our first choice in the downtown area, and Main Street as our second choice. AND another biggie...no free internet!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay at the fremont”
Reviews.Author: mamavWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for fourteen years and I have never been treated so badly when it came to getting my comps at the end of the week. We ran about twenty thousand dollars through the machines during our five day stay, and they refused to comp. a $97.00 dollar food bill. I went from the player's club, to a host, to a customer service specialist and got nothing but a runaround. They actually felt they gave me a deal because they comped our five night stay. They should have, because that was the smallest room I have ever been in. Our cash back total at the end of the week was $23.00 for the two of us. What a joke. We earned more than that in comps when we went over to Binion's and played for four hours.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location good value”
Reviews.Author: Codyway2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be near the Fremont Street Experience. Our room was very small but clean and updated with modern decor. This is an old hotel and the plumbing showed it. The toilet was an issue. The bathroom was very small and would not fit a standard toilet with tank. The toilet was similar to what you see in a public restroom. The flush handle was located behind the lid therefore the lid had to be closed first in order to get to the handle and had to be flushed several times after each use. The bathroom seemed to be put together in haste. The sink was tilted back and the sink stopper stayed closed, we had to pull it out completely to allow the sink to drain. The air conditioner in the room could not be controlled and was cold at times. It was also quite loud but this turned out to be a blessing as our room was located directly above the Fremont Street Experience which was quite loud. The air conditioner served as "white noise" to block out the sounds of the street below. I was surprised to find the room had plantation shutters instead of black out drapes but the shutters worked well enough blocking out the light. These are not five star accommodations but we were quite pleased with the price and the modern decor. I was really impressed at how friendly and happy all of the staff at the Fremont were. We ate dinner at Tony Roma's which was quite good. The buffet is typical of the buffets of old Las Vegas, not very good. We had breakfast there. Not a lot of choices but you can have an omelet made to order and your coffee cup is kept full and again the staff were all friendly. We went in all of the casinos downtown and in our opinion the Fremont gave the friendliest customer service and was the only casino that we could find a cocktail waitress taking orders for comp drinks.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: MELLOW51
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the fremont and loved it.The rooms are small and very clean.But i dont go to a casino to stay in my room.The casino was excellent and done very good on the slots.The staff was great and every one i delt with was just as friendly as could be.Ive been staying on the strip for 11 years and needed a change.Im glad i picked the fremont and will go back..The fremont gets a" EXCELLENT " from me.

Reviews.Title: “Sam Boyd's Fremont Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: ussokinawa
Reviews.Content: The property itself is old but extremely clean and safe. The casino restroom is brightly lit and very clean. The guest room is somewhat spartan but who stays in the room aside from sleeping or a quick rest in Vegas? It seems like Fremont's housekeeping department has very high standards--the guest room we occupied was extremely clean! Also, the towels and toiletries were provided generously. And no strands of hair or debris of any sort! You always felt safe on the casino floor especially if you are accompanying an elderly spouse because the hotel security is quite good. You can always spot a security officer, but they are never in your face. The hotel staff are all courteous and very helpful--they are not pushy and will always assist you when you ask for help. The properties on downtown Vegas are old, but the Fremont Hotel and Casino is very clean and safe place. Not too fancy like the strip but very dandy and fun. The hotel restaurant features a decent buffet so you really don't have to leave the property for anything! And the pricing at both the restaurant and cafeteria--not bad at all! The biggest asset of this hotel is safety! Never a bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown appeal, that's it.”
Reviews.Author: mares81
Reviews.Content: I liked the low limits, the closeness of it all compared to the strip and most of the folks were nice and friendly. The room was clean, as was the rest of the place. A little more smokey than the big strip places but I liked the old Vegas charm of it. I gambled at the El Cortez down the street and loved it. That place is the one for downtown. My wife liked the closeness to everything on Fremont St so that's why this hotel, but next time I will either stay at Golden Nugget or El Cortez. E.C. had buck roulette spinning on three tables. Love that place. The Plaze had a ten buck a night deal so we checked that place out and it seemed comparable to our place. Pretty clean and willing to have you business. We also loved the quaint old school charm of the Golden Gate casino. Mermaids casino was all about jamming drinks down your throat from the moment you walk by, so you plunk a few quarters in there slots. Downtown was jamming for about three-four hours in the evening but other than that, it felt like a ghost town. I hope they can pump that area up a bit, it needs it.

Reviews.Title: “free upgrade to suite! but don't like valet service”
Reviews.Author: Lab4games
Reviews.Content: we booked a standard room and checked in after midnight. the front desk lady was friendly and whispered to us that they do not have any more standard room and will ugprade us for free to suite! at the top floor of the hotel. ok the suite is smaller than most big hotel but it is still great. 1 king bed, full sofa set. 2 LCD tv in room. walk in wardrobe and clean toilet. i would think the normal rooms are ok too. service is good. friendly staff. bad thing is the valet. very troublesome to get the car for a short trip out. sadly there is no free internet

Reviews.Title: “First stay downtown....loved it!”
Reviews.Author: flipflops68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas staying at the Fremont Hotel downtown and we are glad we did! Great location and friendly people! Great Food.... We have always stayed on the strip.....but, we were ready for a change! Did NOT even go to the STRIP! We were entertained by gambling in the friendly casinos and restaurants which were wonderful! Great VALUE........ we just wanted to hang out for 4 days and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Galstonlad
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last year for a few days on the weekend before moving to the strip during the week because it was way cheaper, about $50 a night. It was worth every penny. The rooms were updated and just as good as the room we had at New York New York. The odds at the tables were better than the strip and the dealers were very friendly and explained the rules to newcomers well. Check-in was quick and painless. Highly recommended if you don't mind missing the glitz of the strip for a whole lot less money for a room. Save a hundred a night on the room and spend it on the strip, it's only a 15 minutes bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: CVNMIZZZT
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Vegas and first time staying down on Fremont Street. I would stay at the Golden Nugget next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: reb1671
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 sisters in law, and brother in law stayed for four nights and thought the accomodations were outstanding. We accepted an offer of 3 free nights and $150.00 in food having never stayed at the Fremont. Our rooms were obviously just renovated and the updating was very tastefully done. The breakfast buffet was especially good and the omelet fixed fresh by a cook was a treat. Some food at the evening buffet was overdone but on a whole was good. The Thursday night buffet at Main Strret Station was as good as usual. We rarely eat more than one buffet on a trip to LV but the food offer was too good to resist. We travel to LV yearly from Indiana and will stay at the Fremont when we come next year. We have stayed at the Nugget, Binion's, and Fitzgerald's downtown and many places on the Strip over a 20 year period. We love to gamble downtown and appreciate that the hotel and food available at hotels are equal to those on the Strip. Thanks for the offer, Bconnected team!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixsuns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fremont Hotel for two nights. I liked the contemporary design of the room. It was clean and comfortable. The Paradise Buffet inside the hotel is not expensive (7.99 for lunch) but it's not great. No high-speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice”
Reviews.Author: anonymousreviewer10
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the Vegas experience with an opulent themed hotel, you should definitely avoid the Fremont. If, on the other hand, you want a perfectly nice, simple place to stay and you don't need all the bells and whistles of Vegas, this is a great place to stay. Location? No, it's not The Strip, but that's a good thing. Fremont Street is exciting in its own right, less chaotic, and certainly less crowded. Ambiance? Fine. Again, it's much more akin to what you would find in a nice hotel in another city, rather than Vegas, and that's a good thing. Rooms? Small, but the beds are comfortable and the colors are soothing. Where the hotel could improve is on housekeeping. My room, which was ostensibly non-smoking and had a shiny plaque on the door which promised such, reeked of smoke. In addition, the sheets on the bed on the first night actually had several huge rips and holes. Housekeeping picked up the slack the next day and the room was kept impeccably after that, but I'm still wondering how anyone could possibly have thought it would be acceptable to make up a bed with ripped sheets. Aside from that, the stay was fine and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is getting like up town in service”
Reviews.Author: kobodom
Reviews.Content: I love going to Veags and staying in the "cheap" places 'cause I like going out of the room /hotel as much as possible, but the Fremont thinks thay belong to the MGM properties. Room was great, but parking is a valet that works on tips. A few years ago, you could park across the street in the parking garage, but even that's limited now. To confirm the rom as well, had to sign up for their casino points card. How often do you gamble in the same place-in Vegas? in short, good deal but watchout for 'freebies" and the food. Besides the Paradise buffet they have, anyting else there is crap!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money. Signing up for players card pays off.”
Reviews.Author: JB1981
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to the Fremont last November. Let me first say that we don't go to Vegas to see shows and walk around. We go to Vegas to gamble for hours on end and drink alot of beer. While the cleanliness leaves something to be desired, the staff is extremely friendly and always helpful. We both play blackjack and find that the blackjack pays outs are better than the strip (3:2 vs 6:5) and table limits are usually $5...sometimes $3! The drink service is very good and a dollar tip now and then will ensure that you will never be thirsty. I had one instance where a server removed a quarter full beer from my hand just to give me a cold one. The dealers are hit or miss in the friendliness department, but for the most part they are fine. Finally, signup for the BConnected players card. We were there for 3 days and did a fair amount of gambling (8-9 hours per day), at the end of our stay, both rooms were comped! And we were only betting the $5 minimum most of the time. My friend and I are going back in a few weeks and we have books separate rooms and once again, both comped. We are by no means high rollers but it shows they appreciate the little bit we do bring. If you want an affordable, friendly stay that is away from the Strip...Fremont is it.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair Practice”
Reviews.Author: nomoa
Reviews.Content: Room was very stink from smoking. Staff at the Paradise Cafe were very unfriendly and seem that they did not care about guest, food was terrible. More than 7 slots machines were locked down due to guest having them locked. It was hard trying to find a cocktail waitress to order drinks. Floor attendants were not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “New Years”
Reviews.Author: cannonman55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the freemont hotel it was a basic room the beds were comfortable the party outside on the street was fantastic we ate at binions downstairs restaraunt 3.99 breakfast and 3.99 buger and fries and pot. I found the free booze not watered down like on the strip. you actually got drunk . Going again this year staying at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellieAnnL
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I booked a room with two double beds and even though we arrived at the hotel earlier than planned, were able to check right in. There was not a wait to check in or out. Hotel room itself was very nice. The bathroom is on the small side, but they do have the curved shower rod so you dont feel cramped in the shower. The beds were comfortable and room was very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed three nights and I did request a room change after the first night, due to room right next to the Fremont Street Experience was loud. But even that ends at midnight, so if you stay up late, you will not have an issue with that. The front desk was very helpful about changing rooms and the next two nights were even better. They provide a room safe at no charge, which is great if you do not and to take all you money out with you. I have stayed at hotels on the strip that were not a pleasant as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Downtown Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: onespiceylady
Reviews.Content: Date: January 20, 2009 Reviewer: A Trip Advisor Member, Shreveport, La My mom and I stayed 3 free nights at the Fremont Hotel Las Vegas. The rooms are small but clean and the beds are comfortable as others have said. The bathroom is even smaller but was able to accomodate the 2 of us. The buffet was okay but not many food choices, Tony Romas was good though. The front desk staff were very helpful and nice. The first room they gave us had a terrible view. We called back downstairs and they immediately gave us a room with a view of the main street. Overall we were satisfied with our stay and would definately stay there again. There was no wait checking in or checking out.

Reviews.Title: “No!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nosneh
Reviews.Content: Ok, if you come to Vegas you want to stay on the strip unless these things apply to you. You like being around old people. You are Ugly. Or like ugly people You are Weird, (like clinically nuts) or like them You want a sub par time. You don’t like fun. If Lights flashing over your head is The Best it can get for you. If you like old or ugly wait staff, and employees serving you. (To be fair some are not old or ugly but few and far between) You like to wait a long time to get a drink. You like Small Rooms. You like old casino machines. You like tacky decoration. You don’t care about ambiance. Basically, Vegas is located on the strip, not downtown, The Casinos there suck compared to the strip. The entertainment sucks compared to the strip. The people who go here are not attractive or exciting or fun or happy, unless they are stumbling drunk. You do indeed pay for what you get... Pay more and stay at a well known casino hotel on the strip, MGM, New York New York, Belagio, Planet Hollywood, Wynn, Encore, Paris, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandelay Bay, or whatever, Just stay on the Strip, you will enjoy your time and the people around you much more.
