You don't have to be a model or anything but I guarantee you will not be seeing any of these in the downtown area. I have learned my lesson and will never go back there again. Yuck. I’m not stuck up, I’m not vain. I am a normal guy who likes to have a good time, and feel like I am being treated when I go on vacation. I wish I could stay at Encore (a little too expensive, maybe some day) till then MGM, Mandalay, or the others I listed) Go downtown if you were offended from my comments in the first part of this message. Sounds cross, sounds even mean. However it’s true.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in; Checked Out - Immediately”
Reviews.Author: graham072442
Reviews.Content: Decided on Fremont because of its location and because I'd heard it was recently renovated. Specifically indicated room was for ONE person and reserved room with 2 full beds. Arrived at 11:30 p.m. Was directed to room with one kingsized bed. Very small room with only available electrical outlet at a location where I could not use CPAP machine. They don't show the bathrooms on the virtual tour for a reason: they are about the size of a gutted walk-in closet - or smaller. Very miniscule shelf space in bath; if I'd left cell phone on shelf to charge (only other electrical outlet), it would have vibrated into toilet. Asked for different room, was told "company policy" is only one bed for one person; not true since I've stayed at other Boyd properties in 2-bedded room. Front desk was not at all helpful. Insisted and was directed to an identical room (and bath) on another floor. At that point, I called Main Street Station (owned by same company) and arranged to stay there; checked out and moved. Main Street comped me for the night that was by then almost over and gave me spaceous room with sufficient electrical access and bathroom facilities. Main Street is cleanest hotel I've ever used.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: They have really cleaned up the downtown area in recent years. We have never stayed downtown before, but were very impressed with the value. The fremont does not offer self-parking but does have a valet service that was always friendly and fast. The rooms were recently renovated with good taste, and everything was clean and well-kept. The downside to our room was that we had a view of the air conditioner unit, but we couldn't really complain since we only paid $30 CAD a night (which included friday night!). We didn't have the chance to eat at the fremont as they close their buffet for several weeks in december (dec 12ish - jan). The casino is a little bit smokier than others, but was chock full of people at all hours (mostly hawaiians). The front desk staff were very friendly. I would recommend renting a car and staying here, its a better value than strip hotels. Also, try the main street station buffett, its really fantastic (especially for the price!! $7.77 for lunch!).

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Fremont”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead88
Reviews.Content: Another good stay at the Fremont. This is the first time that we have had a rental car and found the valet to be quick and efficient. As usual check in was a breeze and my request for a refrigerator in the room was delivered upon in a matter of minutes. As I have always said the rooms are small but nice and the staff all over the property is more than friendly. Enjoyed a great meal in Tony Roma's. Love the atmosphere and had a great time. I recommend the Fremont to anyone looking for a good place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money, just don;t expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Vickyjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 3 of us in a room which worked out to around £10 a head or less. For that you can't complain. It was clean with a good location, as a place to rest your head it was more than adequate. The room was dated but clean, comfy and spacious, just don't expect it to be glizty because it isn't, it does what it need to do. If you fancy a cheap base and would rather spend you money on going out then this place is great. I'd say it was a better room than the Plaza but that could just be luck of the draw. It lacks atmosphere in the casino so for a first timer I'd not go there, you want your Wow factor so the Nugget or a strip hotel would be better, and there is no pool. For a cheap base It is fab but I wouldn't want to be paying over $45 dollars per room for two as there are always deals to be had somewhere. We stayed here for 3 days while the Golden Nugget was expensive ($120 a night) then when their prices went down mid week we moved to the Nugget. It worked well, i'd consider doing a similar split between here and a fancy strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fremont”
Reviews.Author: BumBleB83
Reviews.Content: Fremont is close to the bus terminal going to the Strip,pretty much accessible to everything...When we get there, check in is quick, I didn't know that our room is a smoking room, we stayed there for 1 night. then I asked the front desk to change my room the next day which they did.... Everybody is so friendly and the room is super clean. I would recommend this hotel to All... Very good buffet restaurant, there's Tony Roma, Dunkin Donut, We got a $5 ticket for 24 hours to go around the strip, which is really cool... Fremont will always be my choice of hotel, and we will most definitely go back....

Reviews.Title: “I totally reccomend this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: moorecin66
Reviews.Content: The Fremont Hotel is a awesome place to stay. My Friend and I meet at least twice a year from Hawaii and San Diego for our Birthdays. We have the best time, and we usually don't venture too far from the hotel. The rooms are always clean and the staff in the casino are very nice. I like eating at Tony Ramos--one of my favorite Restaurants. The Fremont Hotel will always be my choice of places to stay. I like it so much I'm coming back November/2008 with my girlfriend ofcourse!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Keisha F
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms are really cute. I like the decor in it's attempt to be modern and young. The check-in process is quick and easy. The staff is polite and professional. They only have valet parking in the hotel, but it's free. They just ask that you tip the valets. I did not try any of the restaurants, but I did try the Dunkin Donuts - a handy place to have if you don't have time for a sit down meal. They offer $.99 margaritas and $2.00 Heineken at the bars. I can't speak to the gambling as I didn't do any. We're just there for a place to sleep and it fit the bill for the most part. My only complaint is that it can get really loud. My friend and I went back to our room around 8pm on Saturday night to try and catch a nap before heading out for the evening. It was almost impossible though because of the blaring music coming from Fremont Street. I'd fall alseep and then wakeup when they started a new song. I think the people on the street had to be going deaf because it was insanely loud. Perhaps if we'd gotten a room on a different side of the building it'd have been quieter? Otherwise, the rooms were clean and a decent size. The TV in the room was quite small - I believe it was 19". One of the smallest I've seen in a hotel room. It's not a hotel for younger guests (my friend and I are in our mid 20s and early 30s). The average age of the guests there I'd guess was around 50. In any case, Fremont was a great deal for the price and I'd probably go back provided I could get a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: like2travellots
Reviews.Content: We (me and wife) stayed at the Fremont for the weekend of Aug 8-10 before moving to the Stratosphere (see my other review) for Aug 10-15. We were visiting Vegas for our 21st anniversary. The price at the Fremont was half the Stratosphere for the weekend at $54 per night (Fri and Sat night). The room was super clean - a little on the small side - but did have a full King Size bed and full bath - not much else fits in the room. But you know what - it was great for the few hours we actually spent in the room. The staff at this hotel / casino are great from the Valet to front desk to cocktail waitresses and dealers - all super customer service. The check in at the hotel from car drop off at valet to our room took a whole 5 minutes and our check out was even quicker!! The drink service in the casino was better then any other casino we vistted this week (and we went to a lot!) We had champagne brunch both Saturday and Sunday in the buffet - very nice buffet - one of the better ones we ate at. With 2 for 1 from hotel checkin the first day and comped 2 for 1 the second day we had champagne brunch with tip for less then $20 for the two of us. Great $3 blackjack and video poker selection. Nice enough casino with a Dunkin Donuts in the middle for morning coffee. But the best part of this hotel is its location - from our room to the middle of Fremont Street with access to Four Queens, Golden Nugget etc. took less than 3 minutes. Down the hall, down the elevator, short walk through casino and you are outside. Anyways I think you get the idea - this place is great - we wanted to stay downtown for the weekend and experience Fremont Street without having to drive back to the strip at night - and we got a great treat. We may even stay here for the whole week on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “One quick night”
Reviews.Author: shrek61
Reviews.Content: I needed 1 night (a Friday) and booked with my Credit Card points so it was a free stay. Very easy to arrive, they only have free valet parking so that was a snap. Check in at 5pm was also a breeze. Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable. The safe had a missing key, called the desk and someone was there in 10 minutes. When he couldn't get the lock changed I went down and they gave me a new room. All staff that we interacted with were very nice. I do not have one complaint. Ate at the Buffet for brunch on Saturday with a 2 for 1 deal, the selection and quality were outstanding. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Fremont on Friday June 13. Since I was staying by myself, my room was small and had one double bed. Clean and comfortable. The one thing I noticed, I had to reserve a smoking room for booking late. Did not think to try and change it upon check in. The room itself did not smell like smoke but my pillows did. Was tired and didn't do anything about it. I really like how you don't have to walk far from the elevators to your room. I don't really like to gamble in the casino here, it's fairly small. I don't care for the food at the Fremont. The buffet is just ok and the food at the Lanai Express is awful (chinese food and shrimp cocktail). However, my sister likes the food at Lanai Express. Golden Gates has a great shrimp cocktail. Good prime rib at the 4 Queens and Binions. Also had a donut about 12:30 in the morning at Dunkin Donuts, it wasn't very fresh. I still love the rooms here and the rates are great. There are other casinos and food close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Straightflushhearts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fremont from June 1-6, 2008. Felt comfortable booking here because of the the reviews we read. The hotel was just as we expected, nothing fancy but comfortable and clean. Checked in around 2pm and the process took less than a minute. Very friendly check in, almost scary that this could take such short time. Felt like everyone knew us like neighbors. Our room did not have a safe (was removed for some reason) so they moved us to another room on the same floor immediately after maintenance came and looked at the room. Bathroom is small but clean and no problem for us. It might be a problem if there were four people trying to get ready for a dressier event at the same time but we just gambled the whole trip. Everything else in the room was just fine. True, there are not many TV channels but there was local news, ESPN, national news, and weather channel. The location is close to everything. Played a lot at Golden Gate because they had $3 blackjack and always openings at the $5 tables. The California was good because the had the Let It Ride table open in the morning. The 99 cent shrimp cocktail at the Golden Gate is great and David Sommers playing the piano at the bar was super. The pickup and drop off for the duece (bus to the strip) was very close. We did not like the gambling at the Fremont because the Let it Ride did not open until about 8pm, we couldn't get on a blackjack table in the evening, and the blackjack table (dealing out of a shoe) was not open in the morning. We ate breakfast at the Fremont every morning and liked the buffet. Can not complain about the price. Two evening meals at the 4 queens was also very good. One evening meal at the California was not very good. Will definately stay here on our future trips. We go to Vegas about once a year or every 9 months. Have stayed on the strip before but found ourselves downtown the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cafe for eating downtown - period”
Reviews.Author: GrayWolf5
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at this Casino - but it has the best Cafe for eating downtown. We stayed downtown 5 night and tried lots of places to eat and the Fremont Casino Cafe had the best food. We ate there 4 times.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Old Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BelleArt
Reviews.Content: This was at least my 6th stay at the Fremont in the past ten or so years. I joined other family members there as we celebrated a landmark birthday for my Mother. I like staying downtown in "Old" Las Vegas--everything you need is right there and there are plenty of cheap shuttles or buses if you wish to go to the Strip or to the Mall or anywhere else. As other reviewers have said, the rooms at the Fremont are reasonably priced and adequate. I do not need a fancy hotel, but I like cleanliness and comfort. My bed and pillow were very comfortable and the sheets were crisp and clean; the lady from housekeeping, Katie, was very pleasant and accommodating and asked every day if we wanted our sheets changed. In my Mother's room there was a problem with the water not draining out of the tub, and we reported this; the plumber came right up and discovered the same problem in our neighbor's tub and snaked out the drain. . . I really did not want to know about all this. The bathrooms are small, reminding me of bathrooms in Italian hotels. The water in the shower is marvelously hot and the pressure, great. I loved the view in my room of the Sierra Nevadas and the nearby hotels. Unfortunately, the windows do not open, at all, so you can't get a breath of fresh air. There is an air conditioner/heating unit in the room which makes for some kind of air circulation; despite this, and despite the fact that we were on a no smoking floor, secondhand smoke drifted up through the elevator shaft, I guess, and sometimes came into my room under the door. I rolled up a towel and put it against the space under the door when I went to bed at night. There is also a considerable amount of cigarette smoke in the casino on the lower level which you have to walk through to get to your room. There was a small keyed safe in the room, an ironing board and iron, a hair dryer, plenty of towels, cups, ice bucket, and a TV. The usual pad of hotel paper was missing, there were just a few little pieces of white paper and a pen. Plenty of hangers. An upholstered chair and little table and also suitcase stands. The Fremont provided my Mother with some coupons for discounts in the hotel's restaurants; although they looked nice, the coupons weren't all that much of a bargain. We ate at the Paradise Buffet on a Friday night when it was seafood night, and it was a real disappointment. I guess, being a New Englander, I should know to avoid seafood out West, but this used to be a really nice buffet. I think the restaurant has been cutting corners to save money as the quality was not that high--iceberg lettuce on the salad bar and few interesting raw veggies for the salad; manufactured rolls and desserts; breaded shrimp that looked like Mrs. Paul's, etc. The restaurant space was gorgeous, but the hotel should be more careful because the quality is slipping. I liked the new Dunkin Donuts tucked away in a corner of the casino--nice for an inexpensive coffee and bagel. And we always love the 99 cent margaritas! I am not a wild gambler, but I play the slots a little. I have had one of the casino's "Gold Cards" that you put in the machine to tot up your credits. In all my visits through the years, I have never been able to use my credits for anything because the Fremont says you need to first reach 5,000 credits before you can cash them in for a meal, etc. Well, this is a ridiculous policy. I use my other little card at Binion's Horseshoe across the street and you can redeem your credits, no matter how few they are, towards a meal any time you wish; you don't even have to get a "comp coupon" ahead of time. In general, I would say that everything cost more in all the casinos and restaurants during this visit to Vegas; seems everyone has raised their prices to accommodate the current economy in the U.S. I guess. Even the slots were miserably tight, although I did see a few folks around me hitting four of a kind once in awhile. But no big ones!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: Lernie
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the recommendations from other travelers in this site. I got what I expected. The review before mine indicated the hotel had no ice bucket or ice machine but at least on the 7th floor where I stayed there was one next to the stairs. Also Im 5'11'' and had plenty of room while sitting in the toilet. The rooms seemed to be newly remodeled and clean. Like old Vegas hotel/casinos the rooms at the Fremont were designed as a place to crash between gambling binges and not a room to hang out or conduct business. The TV had CNN (plus 9 other channels) and pay per view movies and I thought it was sufficient. This is the first time I stayed Downtown and I think Im coming back. If you want to visit other casinos within walking distance and cheap prices on booze and food the Fremont is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel with no extras”
Reviews.Author: hapihart
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel. If you want extras, you won't get it here. The room was clean, average size, but missing alot of amenities that you might not even think about until you need them. It did not have a desk, any internet service in the room, or ice bucket because the hotel has no ice available. The hotel has no fitness center and no business center. The bathroom was a little cramped. There's something about knocking your knees on the door while sitting on the toilet. The TV was small and only had very basic channels. I guess they want you down in the casino gambling, not up in your room watching TV. It is fine if you are just sleeping in it, which most people coming to Las Vegas are doing. But I'm here on business and it's a little difficult without a few of the business related amenities. I was also disappointed to see that there was not an extra security lock on the door. As a single person traveling, I appreciate the extra security lock, and notice when it's not there. The price was definitely good. It's in the old section of town, on Fremont Street, but there is easy access by bus to the newer section of town if you want to wander.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown experience”
Reviews.Author: kmbkat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several downtown Vegas hotels but this was the first time I booked a room at the Fremont. I was pleasantly surprised; yes the room is small and bathroom even smaller, but the room was clean and bed was comfortable. The hotel employees were friendly and our requests were taken care of promptly. Check in was the fastest I've ever experienced and I never had to wait for an elevator. I didn't care much for the food but they did have a good coffee spot. The only negative thing I can say about the Fremont is their lack of room darkening drapes. They have plantation shutters>>>come on this is Vegas. After pulling an all nighter the last thing I wanted to see was the sun in my eyes. I like to stay up most of (or all) the night and sleep late when I visit Las Vegas. I wish the Fremont would change their window coverings. But that's just my own personal gripe. Overall I had a fantastic time at the Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Humble, but a great value”
Reviews.Author: FTAListCom
Reviews.Content: I'd simply say 'ditto' to the other reviews here, but that wouldn't help much. But since I won't be covering new ground, I'll try to keep it brief; read more reviews for more details. It started with a great rate when I booked my room from the hotel web site. A week later, the rate had dropped, and when I emailed, they matched the new rate. By the time I checked in, the rate was up again, but I still paid the lower price I had locked in. Check-in was friendly, painless and fast. The elevators were across from the front desk; no extra walks on narrow paths between slot machines. The room was small but adequate; so was the bathroom. It was all clean, and the bed was soft and comfortable. Adjustable wooden shutters filtered most of the morning light from the window. The old-fashioned air conditioner cooled the room just right when running at full blast. The TV channel selection was very basic, but had the local networks, the Weather Channel, TBS and ESPN. Free shampoo, conditioner and lotion. There was a wall safe too small for most laptops, an iron and ironing board, a hair drier, but no coffee maker. There were several very well-priced dining options and a 24-hour Dunkin Donuts. It was an easy walk to the entertainment of Fremont Street, or to catch the 108 city bus going to the Convention Center or the airport. You'd never call this place a luxury hotel, so I can't rate it 5 of 5. But it's adequate in every way and a great value. If you don't need a pool, the Fremont should work well for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good risk!”
Reviews.Author: contactme99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fremont Hotel April 11-13. Was initially worried because our booking was done at the last minute and this was the most reasonably-priced hotel we could find (we wondered whether there was somehting wrong with it). Well, the hotel was certainly good for the price! We had a late check-in and didn't encounter any problems. We got the two beds we requested and going to the room was a breeze - the elevator was right across from the registration desk (no long walks!) and our room was two doors down from the elevator. The room was certainly nice. It was clean and updated, and had an Asian touch - from the window shutters and the decor, to the carpet that had a bambo design. The bathroom wasn't as small as I had feared and I liked the fact that the towel rack wasn't above the toilet as where most hotels disgustingly place theirs. We had good meals at The Paradise Buffet. Even for breakfast, the items were heavy and the selection was good. The price was $10.99, however, and not $6+, as we were there on a weekend. The hotel has a Dunkin Donuts branch, but If you want to purchase any food there, my advice woud be to get them ONLY in the morning when they're fresh. For those unfamiliar with the Fremont Street Experience or the hotel area, the hotel's official address is on Fremont St. but drivers can't use that road to locate the hotel. From south Las Vegas Blvd, go past Fremont St. and make a left on the next block (Ogden St.) and make another left after 3rd St. and look for the building's parking entrance on the left. The hotel has no self-parking option (valet-only but free), so be prepared for extensive tipping if you decide to keep using your vehicle for city trips.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Duz
Reviews.Content: We just completed our stay at the Fremont Hotel & Casino and had a great time. The staff there was wonderful and went out of there way to assist us (we even had the Slot Floor Supervisor, Pam Carrollo search for my husband because she had accidentally done something wrong on his players card and wanted to correct it). Even the housekeeper on our floor was fun. Every morning when we left our room (still feeling the effects from the night before) she would greet us with a big smile and a huge "GOOD MORNING", which made it a little easier to start our next day. The buffet was great and the casino offers exclusive table games which we found to be a blast. The room was a little small, but had everything we needed for our stay (including a view of Fremont Street). Can't wait to go back!!! Well worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ray_Home
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! We got a real cheap price using Kayak.com... Not expecting much, esp. from an older hotel/ casino, were we treated like royalty. Upon arrival, our vehicle was valet parked. At the desk, we were upgraded, w/o asking to a suite. Our accomodations were impeccable. We enjoyed our suite, the restaurant (an excellent buffet), and some gambling. Not once did we feel pressure to drink, gamble or partake in anything we did not feel comfortable doing. We felt absolutely at home and enjoyed everything offered. Would we stay there again? In a heartbeat! I am physically disabled and EVERYTHING was accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: biggunzz
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas every two weeks and stay on Fremont quite often. The room was small and the TV outdated,especially compared to the 4 Queens just across the street. No inroom internet access and no room service made this feel like a 1950's trip. I caught a stomach virus and when requested late checkout I was told no twice. Finally a manager gave me 5pm,as my fever was over 100,but charged my 66$ for a few extra hours. If I had to stay here again, I would not go back to Vegas. It was that bad. The Manager at the front desk was far from professional,and should not be in her position. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Rooms are brand new, Employees very nice”
Reviews.Author: mccaffrey4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fremont Feb 20-23, 2008. The room was newly remodled and very clean. Like everyone else says, the bathroom is small, but manageable. Only complaint about the room was the drain didnt drain well in the tub. My Wife and I loved the hotel and casino, everyone was very nice, and had great drink service. The Fremont is also right in the middle of the Fremont Experience, so you can walk everywhere without losing your breath (like on the strip). The valet parking is free and fast (make sure you throw them a buck or two when they give you your car), and it is easy to get to from the airport. We ate at the Tony Romas for dinner, for the $11 steak and lobster, which was great and couldnt beleive they dont charge more for it! We ate at the buffet once for breakfast, they have a big selection and cheap prices. We would defenitely stay there again. It was only $45/nt for the weeknights, and $110 for the friday we were there. Again, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ohiofam
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, but we were very happy with the property. The front desk staff were all very friendly and checked us in very quickly. The room was nice. The bed was fairly comfortable, but the bathroom was a little small. That, to us wasn't a big deal. I was very happy with the room itself. No major complaints. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was wonderful. I would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly environment”
Reviews.Author: calvinNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Hotel must have been recently renovated. The bedroom they gave us was on the 7th floor. Fremont St was visible, however, the music was minimal. Also we had a great view of the surrounding mountains. It was a nicely decorated bedroom and had ample space. The bathroom, however, was on the small side. We were greeted by the friendliest staff at check-in. Most of the patrons were elderly (My GF and I are in our 20s) but it was suprisingly fun considering most people were helpful with the games we were playing. I would def stay here again. Just to experience Old Las Vegas far from the modern glitz. It was convenient to the Fremont St experience and other establishments. And the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, eat & gamble”
Reviews.Author: Compucrruiser
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Fremont 3-4 times a year. Just recently had to stay at Ballys (because of business) and I would have rather stayed at this favorite. The rooms have been remodeled, the buffet is one of the best in downtown. They even have a Zagat-rated restaurant with a phenomental T-bone steak dinner deal. It's conveniently located where I can walk to the Walgreens, movie theaters, other hotel casinos (try the Main St Hotel buffet...), and I can walk one block to the bus station and go to the strip for $2. In the past year, I've stayed at the Venetian, Treasure Island, Ballys and the LV Hilton. The small-town atmosphere of this hotel and casino keeps me coming back. Where else can you find $5 blackjack/craps tables, friendly dealers, waitresses and hosts? I'm a $5-10 BJ player and I get full room comps. The strip hotels don't even want to see your players card unless you're playing at $25 a hand. They've got a lot of the new slots, but if your luck turns bad or want a different machine, the other downtown casinos are literally 20 steps away. I hope that not too many will read this review, because if this little secret gets out, it will make it harder for me to get a room there when I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great casino”
Reviews.Author: pamnfam
Reviews.Content: The room was average, but the staff was friendly and the casino was great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and casino- Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: adrixia
Reviews.Content: Okay okay, I know the Golden Nugget is the "best" place to stay downtown. But with the prices they were charging, I decided to go with the Fremont for about half. Well let me say that we came here from two nights at the Flamingo and this was a welcome change! The whole property has recently been redone. Everything is kind of retro-modern in the decor. The rooms were in very nice shape and the casino and lobby areas were clean, fresh, and nicely decorated. I was really impressed. We checked in early, they had a room for us immediately. Do not be expecting any 'views' from the hotel, but we could see Binion's out our window and part of the Fremont Street Experience. The windows opened, too which was very useful. The room is on the small side, but plenty for two people. Bathroom is admittedly cramped, but functional. The food at the Buffet is above average in my opinion, and for the price it has real value. Dinner was $28 for me and my hubby. They had made to order steaks, a carving station, wide selection of seafood and fish, desserts, etc. We ate here twice. The Lenai Express place had some Asian dishes and quickie type food. We also ate at Tony Roma's, again great, and between 4:30 and 7:30 they have a full prime rib dinner for $8! Very good and again great value. Oh and don't miss the $1 margarita's at the casino bar! Downtown Vegas itself has pros and cons. The police are out everywhere, so as long as you stick to the main "drag" you will be safe. That being said, there are more "undesirables" hanging around the casinos than on the strip. I am not a prejudiced or snobby person, but you can tell when a homeless guy gets a buck and comes and sits next to you at a slot. But again, security in the casinos was great, and a once I saw a pit boss ask a guy to leave cause he was sleeping at the blackjack table. Considering the price and the actual size of the property, I was really happy with our stay here. The casino was larger than I thought it would be and even larger than some of the neighboring hotels (Las Vegas Club, 4 Queens). Comparing the Fremont to the other hotels nearby, I am glad I decided to stay here. Everything was new, fresh, service was great and I took some money home! Will stay here again if we decide to visit Downtown Vegas on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “good experience at the Fremont”
Reviews.Author: jocie3333
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Fremont the last time in vegas. We have always loved the downtown area- it has the feel of living in a small town very close to a huge city. The fremont was clean & the rooms are very small but functional. There are tub/shower combos in the rooms. We got a very good deal on the room (like $32 a night). Ate at the Second Street Grill- the steaks were very good & the setting was dark & romantic. The cost was under $100 for meal, a drink & spilt a dessert. Also, ate breakfast at the buffet- it was decent for a regular breakfast. The Fremont even took care of us when our flight was cancelled & we had to stay an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Arean2
Reviews.Content: I had a non-smoking room with a king bed. The room seemed to be recently renovated and the furnishings were reminiscent of those boutique hotels that are cropping up in the big cities. I was very impressed with the bed linens, none of those ubiquitous polyester bedcovers (see picture). The bed was firm but not hard. The room was small (but not European small) with enough room for two people. The bathroom counter and sink was below standard U.S. heights. I'm 5 foot 4 inches and I felt like a giant in there. The towels were neither threadbare nor fluffy and they did the job they were designed do. My room overlooked the Fremont Street Experience and I could hear a constant hum/thrum in the room at nights. The television small with limited free stations. I would like to have a better selection of channels. An mini-refigerator and a cofee maker would also have been nice. The only area in the room that didn't seem updated was where the luggage, clothes hangers and iron/ironing board were stored (see picture). There was also a "safebox" that locked with a key. It was pretty flimsy by way of a safe, but at least you could lock up any valuables. I had breakfast and dinner at the Paradise Buffet which served mediocre to average fare. I feel I got a good value for the price paid -- better ambience compared to a similarly priced (overpriced) property like Best Western, Ramada Inn, Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn and others of that calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Everything!!”
Reviews.Author: raymar63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fremont Jan.5-9, 2008. We arrived by 11am and the front desk had our room ready. We have stayed on the strip and usually at the Golden Nugget but decided to try the Fremont. What a great choice me made. All personel were very friendly and willing to help from the front desk, house cleaning to the bell hop. Such a great location as you can be on Fremont Steet in seconds. We ate at the Paradise buffet for breakfast and dinner and found it to be a wonderful bargin. A Sams Town shuttle bus stops at the side door, by schedule all day long. Great fun to go there as Sams even has a movie theater which we went to - got us away from the machines. Yes, the room are small but the bed is great. We kept the widow open all day for fresh air and never needed any heat. If you want a nice, clean room at an easy to get around place then this is for you!! We would stay there again, no question. If you want big and fancy do yourself a favor and don't stay here, you will be unhappy!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Fit”
Reviews.Author: CRACKERS9
Reviews.Content: I just spent six days at The Fremont and was delighted that there is still a truly friendly place left in Las Vegas. Every employee I had contact with was kind, helpful and eager to meet my needs. This was everyone from management to custodian. As the owner of a lodging establishment I can only tell you that this seems to be almost impossible to achieve. Rooms are newly updated and well kept plus very quiet. The bathroom may be a bit small for some but served me just fine. Housekeeping staff could not do more to make sure my needs were met, they asked me, not the other way around. Had my best meal in Las Vegas at The Second Street Grill inside The Fremont. Please do yourself a big favor and order the Sizzling Spinach Salad, a meal onto itself. My first time to stay downtown in "Glitter Gulch" on the Fremont Experience. I will not return to The Strip again. Great security and well maintained area, no people pushing all the nudey cards at you that just litter the strip. Plus it is very easy to get around, public transportation readily available, or easy freeway access just blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting--Don't set foot in the place”
Reviews.Author: audreyport2001
Reviews.Content: This joint is so old it is disgusting, dirty and things are falling apart, not to mention the ventilation system. The rooms are very small and musty smelling. The right hand/cold water faucet on our sink broke off and the shower/tub was filthy...you turned on the water and the bottom became dangerously slippery. Then, we tried to turn on the 60's thermostat and once the fan came on, my husband went into a violent coughing attack because so much dust blew out of the vents and into the room. This place needs to be imploded NOW.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: larredc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fremont Hotel for two nights, 12/19 and 12/20. Upon entering the room we noticed that it was on the smaller side. However, it looked as though it had totally been redone recently. The room was updated and looked very nice. The bathroom was also very small, but also looked as if had recently been updated. The room was very clean and comfortable. We slept well on the bed and the room was quiet. Although we didn't have the greatest view, we got what we asked for, a king bed in a non smoking room. For the short amount of time we spent in the room, the view didn't matter. Everybody from the check in staff, to the valet to the cleaning staff were all very pleasent and nice. We have stayed on the strip many times, but looked to save a few bucks on the room for extra gambling money by staying downtown. We are glad that we did, and would stay at the Fremont again. It is not a mega resort with glitsy shows and sights, but is more than sufficient if you want a clean cheaper priced room to sleep in down town. Give it a shot if you plan on trying a stay downtown. The casino was also decent, however there is no poker room. We enjoyed the dowtown atmosphere for gambling, and took a drive to the strip to see a show, but returned downtown for a cheaper gamble. We will be back to the Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Fremont”
Reviews.Author: Clarkson7
Reviews.Content: I took a solo trip to LV and stayed at the Fremont for three comped nights from November 6-9. I was in Room 418 near the elevator. The room was very clean with a comfortable King bed. I stay often at the Fremont and am always satisfied with my visits there. The room is not large, and the bathroom is small, but I consider the Fremont to be an excellent value Downtown. The housekeeping is very good with helpful and friendly staff. I look forward to my next stay at the Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Downtown”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Golden Nugget last time we stayed Downtown, we though we'd try out the Fremont and I have to stay it was excellent value for money. Ok - so the casino is a bit dowdy but the check-in was effortless and the room itself clean and comfortable. The bathroom size was smallish but everything functioned satisfactorily. Considering the price we paid, we could not have hoped for better. We would happily recommend the hotel to anyone staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: njeanerMichigan
Reviews.Content: I received my stay as a free comp in the mail. Was surprised to receive a 5 day 4 nite stay. But I took them up on it and am very glad I did. The room was small, but very clean, anyway thats all anyone needs. Only used it to clean up and sleep. Nice comfortable bed and pillows and new furnishings. It was always made up and cleaned early every day. We got there early and was able to check in right away which was great. The buffet was excellent. I enjoyed staying on Fremont street, much better than the strip. Its like a big party every nite. So much to see, without all the walking. Thank you Fremont for the invite. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Bargain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nupe357
Reviews.Content: I had a room at the Flamingo booked for July 22-25 (Sun --Wed) for a great rate of $60/night. However, most of the hotels on the strip (and many off of the strip) were running $120-$250 for Saturday, July 21. I was traveling with my wife and we both realized that this was waaaay too much to pay for a room when that we would spend so little time in. My first thought was the Orleans, but their rooms were running around $120/night for a Saturday stay. With this in mind, I checked around and found a $60/night rate at the Fremont. We had never stayed downtown before but figured we would give it a try.... As others have stated, the room itself was clean and VERY small. Some of the furniture looked updated, but gernally speaking, the room itself was VERY old and dated looking (same for the hallways and common areas). The a/c worked ok but not great and the T.V. got very few channles. However, none of this was very important because after a long day of traveling all we did was fall asleep anyway. In summary, If you're looking for BASIC accomodations at a bargain price in downtown Vegas I think the Fremont fits the bill without a problem. I think if I find myself in the same siutation again I will try the El Cortez or head out to a "local" spot like Sam's Town for the one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenievic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "Fremont for the second time. Not a negative thing to say. Hotel staff very accomadating. We asked for a king non smoking room. It was small but very nice. Comfortable bed and nice linens. We were asked what part of the hotel we would like. I asked for a room away from the Fremont exxperience where it would be quiet. That was not a problem. Never heard any noise. The room attendent was very good. We have no problem with the Fremont and would stay there again. Love downtown. It is very fun and cozy. The strip is fun for us to visit, but not to swtay there.

Reviews.Title: “The All NEW Fremont!”
Reviews.Author: ricoba
Reviews.Content: OK, I got to admit, I like dirty, dingy, downtown Vegas. I like to play awhile at one place and then move on to the next place, all without breaking a sweat! I have stayed in lots of Vegas hotels and when I stay and play downtown, I end up at either the Fremont or the Golden Nugget. This last visit we stayed at a comped room at the newly renovated Fremont. No, the casino, lobby and main areas are all the same, but the rooms have all been tastefully redone and they are very, very nice. Subtle tones, new bedding, and a shower curtain rod that keeps the curtain from flying all over the place during a shower. Sure the Fremont isn't the Wynn, nor does it try to be. The rooms are tiny and old Vegas. Back in the day players weren't expected to stay in their rooms, they were expected to be on the casino floor, so the old rooms are small. But hey, they are really clean, nicely redecorated, comfortable and cheap. If you want the big mega tourist resorts, stick to the Strip. But if you want that old Vegas feeling, check out the newly renovated Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fremond”
Reviews.Author: gamblingwoman
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I've ever stayed in Las Vegas! Never had stayed downtown and I will only stay at the Fremont when I return to Vegas! The location was excellent and the room was exceptionally clean! The blinds were a great alternative to curtains!! The room was quiet and just perfect!!!! I can't wait to stay there again!! Taxis were easy to find to get to go the strip! The food choices were so much better downtown and the prices were so reasonable! Also, the security was very visable not only in the hotel but the entire downtown area!! Highly recommend the Fremont!! My new home in Las Vegas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fell For Fremont”
Reviews.Author: 4ParrotKeeper
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to get away from the hustle and bustle of self employment in a physically demanding job and working with hubby. So I needed a good break. Joining me was my sister (first timer) and a cousin from Arizona met us. Hubby and I had played at the Fremont the previous year and received multiple offers to come back for a comp visit. Thank goodness I put the "rewards play" in my name. At any rate, This was our third stop in a 5 day trip and a three night visit was the Finale in Vegas. This was my first over night at "TF". Arrived earlier than check-in (by about 3 hours) and much to my pleasure found valet parking, had a wonderful bellman unload our stuff, three women can pack it in. My front desk visit/check-in was quite tidy and quick, (no problem with checking in early either), I was met with warm friendly faces and professional service. The check-in area was roomy enough, and tucked away from the hubbub of the casino and any other obstruction. There is no long walk if you enter at the right spot and valet parking is right there. So are the elevators. All so convenient and easy! Once to the room, at first I was shocked at how small. But soon realized it was very clean, quaint and very Zen in design and feeling. I requested back side (away from the laser show noise). The room was nice and cool, the air conditioner provided a gentle hum and we never heard much of anything from outside, except an occasional siren and one day guys were beating on a pipe next door. Not an issue. There was a nearby outside stairwell that my cousin could smoke in. THE BEDS WERE AWESOME. I slept like a baby, when I slept. Casino was great, wish they would have a PaiGow table. I have to say my only disappointment was Tony Roma's, my steak was like leather. Other food great - I sampled most places. The Cafe, after hours in the Buffet was superb and our waiter was a dream. He got a huge tip for just letting us talk and take our time. Not to mention that he was very easy on the eyes! I would go to the Fremont again, it is not posh, it is not elegant. It is comfy, cozy and everything is right there!

Reviews.Title: “Fremont equals convenient!”
Reviews.Author: alohapop
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my Vegas trip 2 days ago. When I saw the pictures posted here, I just had to add my 2 cents because it's a lot different! I'll get to that in a bit. First of all, the location can not be beat. We did not rent a car, thus our means of transportaion was the CAT, or the public bus. Fremont is very close to the bus stop so it is extremely convenient. Now, back to the change. Guest rooms has just been renovated, and when I walked in, I thought I was in a really contemporary hotel. The hallway carpet had a "mod" pattern, and the room itself had a simple, but a modern look. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30PM, but fortunately there is a snack shop open 24 hours which serves anything from a Chinese plate lunch to a local Hawaiian dish. (I'm from Hawaii, by the way, so the "local foods" are always good to have!) The casino is very clean and well kept, the staff all seem like family and are all very friendly and nice. I would definitely come back to Fremont if I stay in Downtown again!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Visit”
Reviews.Author: gristmill
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 12-16 all nights comped. As usaual the room was adequate and the service was great. However, this trip was not free of disappointments. After returning from the strip late Tuesday night, 1/2 of the casino was partitoned off with caution tape. In this area was our favorite machines. Using "caution" we ducked under the tape and began to play the slots. We were immediately and rudely adressed by a staff member stating the area was closed for cleaning. Shortly thereafter, a security officer politely told us to leave the area. I explained that in Indiana , caution meant to proceed using care and thats what I had done. He laughed it off, but ordered us out of the area. Oh well, I saved money and they lost money that night. The comps are becomming hard to come by. Free meals used to flow freely. The Players Card staff seemed very hesitant to issue any free meals, as they have done in the past. We won nothing while gambling at the Fremont. It appears that they have reduced their cocktail watiress staffing. The waitresses have to cover too large of an area, and thus the customers suffer as a result. Overall our experience was okay. Bellman Dave is still the best in the business and deserves special recognition!
